activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christina R Andersen

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:15 AM Defendant Christina R Andersen in court.  Attorney William A Demet in court for Christina R Andersen.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defense indicates the matter is resolved and is seeking a plea and sentencing date. 
BTC: Matter set over for COP.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

3:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christina R Andersen in court.  Attorney William A Demet in court for Christina R Andersen. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense has received an updated global offer from the State. Plans to send a counter offer and is seeking a new status conference date.
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

8:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christina R Andersen in court.  Attorney William A Demet in court for Christina R Andersen. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense makes statements on the record. Does not have a global plea offer. Seeking another status date. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with Walmart stores or its employees. Contact with A.J.A,  C.N.M,  M.J.M only at discretion of CHIPS case and HSD.

1:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christina R Andersen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter in court for Christina R Andersen. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
